p: Essential oils are liquid, volatile, clear, and rarely colored substances that are soluble in organic solvents and usually of lesser density than water. EOs extracted by hydrodistillation from the vegetative aerial parts of the Baccharis species presented a strong and characteristic aroma. The EO of B. punctulata was green, whereas it was yellow in B. microdonta and light yellow in the other species. The yield of EO was 0.58% ( v/ w) in B. microdonta, 0.93% ( v/ w) in B. pauciflosculosa, 0.29% ( v/ w) in B. punctulata, 0.59% ( v/ w) in B. reticularioides, and 0.53% ( v/ w) in B. sphenophylla. As per the literature, the yield of EOs in the Baccharis species ranged between 0.08â€“2.82%. B. obovata Hook. and Arn. presented the highest yield [ 21], whereas the lowest content was achieved for B. lateralis Baker (syn. B. schultzii Baker) [ 22], which were collected in Argentina and Brazil, respectively.
